title: Comparison Iran versus Israel
description:
Hi, all. I just got this from
And thanks to the redditor cwm9, who posted 
Iranian hospitality.
Israeli hospitality.   ...two video articles, 
I immediately saved them for you, the computer user.

I'm not christian. I was, then I grew up and stopped believing in fantasies.
As it turns out, all religions keep people separated, contributing to wars! ("God is on our side," and similar bullshit!) 

God is eternal! It's like the universe! (Another name, perhaps.)
And there's no Big Bang! It's a theory, and not a very good one.
If one compares the special relativity of Einstein with the quantum-cat theory of Schrodinger, theres a way that they can both be true. 
Someone, in a scientific magazine, in the early 70's called it the Relative State Theory. 

It involves the constant splitting of a multi-dimensional universe. 
E.G., When I drop a ball on the table, there seem to be two possibilities: 
1. ball stays on table  2. ball rolls off, and onto floor. 

Both things "happen," or are happening, will happen, etc., permanently. 
I, the scientist, splits into two, around that phenomenon. 
Tony (1) writes in notebook: ball stays on table.
Tony (2) writes: ball falls off, into floor.
But the first Tony doesn't see the second, etc, as the "universe" has split. 
In X dimensions, one Tony lives his life, but in X+1 dimensions, there is room for infinitely many Tonys. 

Another way of saying it is: everything that "can happen" is happening, constantly, forever, being young, middle, old, unborn, and long-ago perished. But the 3-dimensional self, that takes "Time" as the fourth dimension, "experiences" only the present, now, with projections called "the past' and "the future." But he (I mean I, Tony) can't touch the past or future. 

A good book to help learn this is Edwin Abbott's   FLATLAND, A Romance in Many Dimensions
